bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to William F. Wharton, October 1, 1891
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, October 1, 1891
Mr Beverly Y. Payne, To the Department of State.
Accounts and Returns for the quarter ended September 30, 1891.
Consulate General of the United States Monrovia, October 1, 1891.
Hon., William F. Wharton, Assitant Secretary of State Washington D. C.
Sir: I have the honor respectfully to transmit herewith, the Accounts and returns of this Consulate General, for the quarter made September 30th 1891, as per subjoined list of Enclosures.
I have the honor to be, Sir, Your obedient Servant,
Beverly Y. Payne, Vice Consul Gen.

1. Digest of the Invoice Book, 2. Arrivals and Departures of Am Vessels 3. Record of Notarial service 4. Summary of business, 5. Record of Treasury fee 6. General quarterly account 7. Abstract of Contingent Expences vouchers (5)
